content:
Hi everyone! Here from Discord.
Quite interested in Rust development :grinning:
Hi Electrux! What area are you interested in? I may be able to give you some pointers.

Well, honestly, I don't know yet. Truth be told, I haven't even worked on Rust besides going through the rust book a bit (which btw is awesome!)
I do know that I enjoy compiler design and development and would definitely like to (at least, over time) contribute to this project.
I am primarily a C++ developer and Rust seems pretty cool to me :)
Currently going through the rustc-dev-guide and a bit in-depth with the book to understand more about the language.
Sorry, I understand that that's quite vague (and out of nowhere), but I'd like to learn over time and get into the flow of things

To give you an overview of some possibilities you can hack on:

  • codegen,
  • trait & type system
  • borrow checker
  • name resolution, expansion, macros
  • the parser
  • diagnostics in general

there are many more :slight_smile:
oh awesome! thanks! that helps a lot :blush:
Good luck with learning Rust. If you have any questions about the compiler internals you can ask at #t-compiler/help.
